verses.verse: (1 He exhorteth all to serve the Lord,3 who hath chosen us, and preserved us,4 and to enter into his assemblies to praise his Name. ) Sing ye loud unto the Lord, all the earth.
Serve the Lord with gladness; come before him with joyfulness.

Know ye that even the Lord is God; he hath (He chiefly meaneth, touching the spiritual regeneration, whereby we are his sheep and people.) made us, and not we ourselves: we are his people, and the sheep of his pasture.
(He showeth that God will not be worshipped, but by that means which he hath appointed.) Enter into his gates with praise, and into his courts with rejoicing: praise him and bless his Name.

For the Lord is good: his mercy is (He declareth that we ought never to be weary in praising him, seeing his mercies towards us last forever.) everlasting, and his truth is from generation to generation.
